items.title: Exercise 1: Meeting Minutes (Doc A)
items.text:
Doc A — Minutes: Q3 Operations Review

Date: 14th November. Chair: Sarah Jenkins. Secretary: Alex Taylor.
Attendance: SJ, AT, MD, KL. Apologies: RP (Conflict of interest/prior engagement).

1. Approval of Previous Minutes: Approved without amendment.
2. Budget Update: MD pointed out that the software budget had been exceeded by 12%. The Chair urged the team to find cost-savings in the travel budget.
3. Office Relocation: KL suggested postponing the move until Q1. A unanimous decision was reached to table the discussion until next month.
4. Action Items:
   - Action: MD to provide a revised budget draft by Friday 17th.
   - Action: AT to circulate the new seating plan by Wednesday EOD.
5. AOB: KL raised the issue of the broken coffee machine.
6. Next Meeting: 12th December, 10:00 AM.

questions.question: What happened to the discussion about the office relocation?
options: It was postponed (tabled) until next month.
It was deleted from the agenda.
questions.explanation: Doc A states: 'A unanimous decision was reached to table the discussion until next month.'

questions.question: What does 'Apologies: RP' indicate in this document?
options: RP said sorry for being late.
RP is the one who took the minutes.
RP notified the chair they could not attend.
questions.explanation: In meeting minutes, 'Apologies' lists those who sent formal notification that they could not attend.

items.prompt: Exercise 2: Components of Minutes. What is 'AOB' an abbreviation for in a professional meeting?
items.explanation: AOB stands for 'Any Other Business', used for items not on the original agenda.

items.prompt: Exercise 3: Meeting Flow. Which item usually comes immediately after the 'Header' and 'Attendance'?
items.explanation: The standard sequence starts with approving the record of the previous meeting.

items.prompt: Exercise 4: Meeting Vocabulary. Complete the sentence: 'Since we have reached a tie in the vote, the Chair will use her ___ to decide.'
items.explanation: A 'casting vote' is used by the chair to break a tie.

items.prompt: Exercise 5: Reporting Verbs. Rewrite this sentence using the reporting verb 'suggested' to make it sound more professional: 'Sarah said: "Why don't we move the deadline?"'
items.modelAnswer: Sarah suggested moving the deadline.

items.prompt: Exercise 6: SMART Checklist. List the 5 components of a SMART action item.
items.modelAnswer: Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound

items.prompt: Exercise 7: Extracting Action Items. From Doc A, format the task assigned to MD using the standard 'Action: [Name] to [Task] by [Date]' format.
items.modelAnswer: Action: MD to provide a revised budget draft by Friday 17th.

items.prompt: Exercise 8: Courtesy Modals. Which is the most professional way to 'chase' an action item that is overdue?
options: I'm still waiting for the seating plan.
Could you please provide an update on the seating plan, as we’re aiming to circulate it by tomorrow EOD?
Where is the seating plan you promised?
items.explanation: This option uses 'Could you please...' and provides a professional context (circulating it by tomorrow).

items.prompt: Exercise 9: Follow-up Email. Write a 50-word email to the team circulating the minutes from Doc A. Mention the next meeting date.
items.modelAnswer: Hi team, please find the minutes from our Q3 Operations Review attached. A reminder that our next meeting is scheduled for 12th December at 10:00 AM. Please review the action items and provide any updates by Wednesday. Thanks, Alex

items.prompt: Exercise 10: Meeting Terminology. What term describes the minimum number of members required to make a meeting's proceedings valid?
items.explanation: A 'Quorum' is the minimum number of people needed for a valid meeting.

items.prompt: Exercise 11: Oral Summary Prep. Prepare a script for a 3-minute summary for a colleague who missed the meeting in Doc A. Use at least 3 different reporting verbs (e.g., pointed out, urged, suggested).
items.modelAnswer: [Audio Upload Required] Rubric: Use of reporting verbs, Past tense accuracy, Conciseness.

items.prompt: Exercise 12: Oral 'Chasing'. Record a 60-second audio politely chasing KL for the 'Office Relocation' feedback. Mention that it was 'tabled' and needs progress before the next session.
items.modelAnswer: [Audio Upload Required] Checklist: Politeness, Mention of 'tabled', SMART deadline.

items.prompt: Exercise 13: Mock Minutes (Portfolio). Write a set of minutes (150 words) based on a hypothetical discussion about 'Improving Office Recycling'. Use the 4 reporting verbs from the theory.
items.modelAnswer:
Minutes: Recycling Initiative. Date: 20th Oct.

Attendance: [List]. Apologies: [Name].

1. Approval: Last minutes approved.
2. Discussion: John pointed out that current bins are overflowing. Sarah suggested introducing separate paper bins. The Chair urged everyone to participate in the new scheme. Mark refused to agree to a weekend training session but agreed to attend a lunchtime briefing.
3. Decisions: Agreed to install 5 new paper bins.
4. Action Items: Sarah to order bins by Monday.
5. Next meeting: TBC.

items.prompt: Exercise 14: Agenda Template. Create an agenda for a 'Website Launch Kick-off'. Include: Date, Time, 3 Main Topics, and AOB.
items.modelAnswer: Agenda: Website Launch. Date: 5th Jan. Time: 2pm. Topics: 1. Project Timeline, 2. Budget Allocation, 3. Resource Assignment. 4. AOB.

items.prompt: Exercise 15: Weekly Mini-test. 1) Define 'Apologies'. 2) What does it mean to 'table' a discussion? 3) List 3 reporting verbs. 4) Correct this SMART action: 'Fix the printer.'
items.modelAnswer: 1) Formal notification of absence. 2) Postpone it until later. 3) Suggest, urge, point out. 4) Action: IT to repair the 2nd-floor printer by Friday 5pm.

items.title: Exercise 16: Hybrid Meeting Logistics (Doc B)
items.text:
Doc B — Team Briefing: Transition to Hybrid

Starting next month, our Tuesday status updates will be hybrid. Six team members will be in the boardroom, and four will join via Microsoft Teams. 

Administrative Protocol:
- Room must be booked 15 minutes early for a 'Tech Check'.
- The chair must actively monitor the 'Hand Raise' feature to ensure remote colleagues can contribute.
- Minutes must be shared via the virtual whiteboard (Miro) during the session to allow real-time collaboration.

questions.question: What is the specific administrative task required 15 minutes before the hybrid meeting starts?
questions.explanation: Doc B specifies booking the room early for a 'Tech Check'.

questions.question: How should remote colleagues be encouraged to contribute according to the protocol?
options: By the chair monitoring the 'Hand Raise' feature
By only speaking when everyone in the room is silent
questions.explanation: The text states the chair must monitor the 'Hand Raise' feature for remote participants.

items.prompt: Exercise 17: Reporting Verbs. Which verb is best for reporting a formal recommendation?
items.explanation: 'Recommended' is the most precise verb for reporting a formal suggestion for action.

items.prompt: Exercise 18: SMART Action Item. Transform this vague task into a SMART action item: 'Finish the filing soon.'
items.modelAnswer: Action: Alex to complete the archive filing for Q3 by Friday EOD.

items.prompt: Exercise 19: Executive Summaries. What is the primary audience for an Executive Summary?
items.explanation: Executive summaries are specifically designed for busy senior managers.

items.prompt: Exercise 20: Tense Shift. Report this sentence from a meeting: 'We will implement the changes next week.' (He said that...)
items.modelAnswer: He said that they would implement the changes the following week.

items.prompt: Exercise 21: Meeting Terminology. What does it mean to 'adjourn' a meeting?
options: To break off a meeting with the intention of resuming later.
items.explanation: To adjourn is to pause or end a session temporarily.

items.prompt: Exercise 22: Reporting Verb Practice (Suggest). Rewrite using 'suggested + -ing': The manager said: 'Why don't we hire a consultant?'
items.modelAnswer: The manager suggested hiring a consultant.

items.prompt: Exercise 23: Digital Etiquette. What is the standard protocol for microphones in a large virtual meeting?
options: Keep them on at all times.
Mute when not speaking to avoid background noise.
Only the chair should have a microphone.
items.explanation: Muting when silent is essential to prevent audio feedback and noise.

items.prompt: Exercise 24: Executive Summary (The 'So What?'). Look at these facts: 'Sales are down 5%, marketing costs are up 10%, we need a new strategy.' Write a 1-sentence 'So What?' summary.
items.modelAnswer: Declining sales and rising marketing costs indicate an urgent need for a strategy overhaul to ensure ROI.

items.prompt: Exercise 25: Meeting Flow. Which phrase would a chair use to move the meeting forward to the next topic?
options: Can we move to the next item on the agenda?
items.explanation: 'Move to the next item' is the standard way to change topics.

items.prompt: Exercise 26: Attendance Vocabulary. Define 'Quorum' and 'Apologies' in your own words.
items.modelAnswer: Quorum: The minimum number of people needed to make a meeting official. Apologies: Formal notice that someone cannot attend.

items.prompt: Exercise 27: Reporting Verb Practice (Point out). Which sentence correctly reports a factual observation?
options: She recommended that the budget was low.
She pointed out that the budget was low.
She urged that the budget was low.
She agreed that the budget was low.
items.explanation: 'Pointed out' is used for stating facts or observations.

items.prompt: Exercise 28: Digital Logistics. List three virtual tools mentioned in the theory for modern meetings.
items.modelAnswer: 1. Zoom/Teams (Video). 2. Miro/Mural (Whiteboards). 3. Teams 'Hand Raise' feature.

items.prompt: Exercise 29: Executive Summary ROI. Why should an executive summary mention the ROI (Return on Investment)?
options: To show the manager how much work you did.
To justify the cost or benefit of a proposal to senior management.
To test the manager's math skills.
items.explanation: Senior management focuses on the financial or strategic benefit (ROI) of decisions.

items.prompt: Exercise 30: Oral Meeting Summary. Write a 3-sentence script summarizing a meeting about 'New Office Furniture'. Use at least two reporting verbs.
items.modelAnswer: The team agreed to replace all the chairs in the reception area. Finance pointed out that we must stay within the Q1 budget. The Chair suggested finalized the order by Friday.

items.title: Exercise 31: Meeting Transcript Analysis (Doc C)
items.text:
Doc C — Transcript: Q1 Budget Review

Chair: Welcome. First, Sarah, did you see the email from IT?
Sarah: Yes, I pointed out that the server costs were rising by 12%.
Chair: That's a concern. John, what do you think?
John: I recommend moving the server migration to Q2 to save costs now.
Chair: Agreed. Let's record that. John, please draft a new timeline by Wednesday.
John: I'll get on it.

questions.question: What factual observation did Sarah make during the meeting?
questions.explanation: Sarah said: 'I pointed out that the server costs were rising by 12%.'

questions.question: What was John's recommendation?
options: To move the server migration to Q2
questions.explanation: John said: 'I recommend moving the server migration to Q2'.

items.prompt: Exercise 32: Reported Speech (Refuse). Report: 'I won't sign this contract' (He refused...)
options: He refused to sign the contract.
He refused that he signs the contract.

items.prompt: Exercise 33: Action Item Table. Based on Doc C, create the 'Action Item' entry for John.
items.modelAnswer: Action: John to draft a new server migration timeline. Deadline: Wednesday.

items.prompt: Exercise 34: AOB Etiquette. When is it appropriate to bring up AOB (Any Other Business)?
options: At the very start of the meeting.
In the middle of a main discussion point.
At the end, when the chair calls for any other items.
items.explanation: AOB is a standard agenda item at the end of formal meetings.

items.prompt: Exercise 35: Objective Language. Rewrite: 'The meeting was a total disaster and everyone was angry.'
items.modelAnswer: The meeting involved a challenging discussion regarding several unresolved issues.

items.prompt: Exercise 36: Verbatim. Why do we usually avoid 'verbatim' reporting in minutes?
options: It makes the document too long and harder to find key decisions.
items.explanation: Minutes should be a summary, not a word-for-word transcript.

items.prompt: Exercise 37: Reporting Verb Practice (Urge). Rewrite using 'urged + object + to': The Chair said: 'Team, you must focus on the deadline!'
items.modelAnswer: The Chair urged the team to focus on the deadline.

items.prompt: Exercise 38: Hybrid Meeting inclusiveness. Why is it important to monitor the virtual 'Hand Raise'?
options: To ensure people in the physical room don't dominate the conversation.
To check if the internet is working.
To count the number of attendees.
items.explanation: Active moderation ensures remote participants have an equal voice in hybrid meetings.

items.prompt: Exercise 39: Executive Summary Structure. List the 4 'Golden Rules' of summarising from the theory.
items.modelAnswer: 1. Focus on the 'So What?'. 2. Use Bullet Points. 3. Eliminate Jargon. 4. Highlight the ROI.

items.prompt: Exercise 40: Proposer/Seconder. In a formal vote, who is the 'seconder'?
options: The person who suggests the motion.
The person who supports the motion after it is suggested.
The person who counts the votes.
The person who writes the minutes.
items.explanation: A motion usually needs a proposer (first) and a seconder (second) before a vote.

items.prompt: Exercise 41: Reported Speech (State). Report: 'The budget is sufficient' (The Finance Manager stated that...)
items.modelAnswer: The Finance Manager stated that the budget was sufficient.

items.prompt: Exercise 42: Agenda circulation. When should the agenda be circulated?
options: Well before the meeting starts (e.g., 24-48 hours).
items.explanation: Participants need time to prepare, so the agenda must be sent in advance.

items.prompt: Exercise 43: Executive Summary Verbs. Create two sentences for a summary using 'concludes that' and 'indicates'.
items.modelAnswer: The report concludes that the project is on track. Data indicates a high level of customer satisfaction.

items.prompt: Exercise 44: Matters Arising. What does this agenda item refer to?
options: Issues that have come up from the previous meeting's minutes.
A list of people who are late.
The date of the next Christmas party.
items.explanation: 'Matters Arising' allows for follow-up on previous actions or decisions.

items.prompt: Exercise 45: Comprehensive Scenario. You are chairing a hybrid meeting. A remote colleague raises their hand. The room is noisy. 1) What is your 'muting protocol' action? 2) How do you 'manage meeting flow'?
items.modelAnswer: 1) Remind all participants in the room and online to mute or stop side conversations. 2) Explicitly call on the remote colleague by name and invite them to speak.
